title: Hitting the Enter key in the Find/Replace dialog does not perform a Find operation on Mac OS X
description: When using Eclipse 3.0 M2 (Build id: 200307181617) on Mac OS X 10.2.6, if you open the Find/Replace dialog (Edit -> Find/Replace) and type in a search term into the text box, hitting the Return key does not do anything. We expect that hitting the Return key should perform a Find operation, just like clicking on the Find button (which is highlighted as the default button in the Find/Replace dialog).
OB: Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog does not perform a Find operation on Mac OS X.
EB: Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog should perform a Find operation on Mac OS X.
SR: The Find/Replace dialog on Mac OS X should respond to the Enter/Return key and perform a Find operation when a search term is entered.
